excerpt: Want to learn how to be happy? Here's are simple tips to live a happy life that you love.

You don’t need… Are you looking for simple habits for living a happy life? Everyone wants to be happy. But finding happiness can feel hard sometimes. The good news is that there are simple things you can do every day to feel better. Small habits can make a big difference in how happy you feel. You don’t need to make huge changes to your life. Instead, focus on easy steps that fit into your regular routine. By adding these habits bit by bit, you can create a happier life for yourself. Happiness and money are also connected (which is why I’m talking about this on a money blog!). When you feel happy, it’s easier to make good choices with your money. Simple habits, like being thankful, exercising, or going outside, can help you feel better and spend less. For example, if you’re less stressed, you might not feel like buying things you don’t need. Spending time with friends or helping others is free and can make you feel good too. These small steps can help you be happier and save money at the same time. Practice gratitude daily Being thankful can make you happier. You can do this in many ways, such as by keeping a gratitude journal where you write down things you’re grateful for each day. This can be as simple as a sunny day or a tasty meal. Other ways include: You can also share your thanks with others. Tell a friend or family member why you appreciate them. A quick text or phone call can brighten their day and yours. Look for small joys in your everyday life. Maybe it’s the smell of fresh coffee or a stranger’s smile. Noticing these little things can change how you see the world. Try to find the good even in tough times. It’s not always easy, but it can help you stay positive. Maybe you learned something new or grew stronger from a challenge. You can also show gratitude through actions. Help a neighbor or volunteer in your community. Giving back can make you feel good and spread kindness to others. Remember, practicing gratitude takes time. Start small and make it a habit. Soon, you might find yourself feeling happier and more content with life. 2. Exercise regularly Getting active is a great way to feel happier. You don’t need to run marathons or lift heavy weights. Even a short walk each day can make a big difference. Exercise helps your body and boosts your mood. It can also help you sleep better at night. When you sleep well, you feel better during the day. Try to move your body for 30 minutes most days. You can split this into smaller chunks if that’s easier. Maybe a 10-minute walk in the morning, afternoon, and evening. Another tip is to pick activities you enjoy. This could be dancing, hiking, swimming, or playing a sport. When you have fun, you’re more likely to keep doing it. 3. Meditate for 10 minutes Taking just 5-10 minutes out of your day to meditate can make a big difference in your life. It’s a simple habit that can help you feel calmer and more relaxed. You don’t need any special equipment to meditate, which is really nice about meditation! Just find a quiet spot where you won’t be bothered. Sit comfortably and focus on your breathing. Even short meditation sessions can help you feel less stressed. You might find it easier to focus on tasks throughout the day. Some people also sleep better when they meditate regularly. There are lots of free apps and videos that can guide you through meditation. These can be helpful if you’re not sure where to start. 4. Read inspirational books Reading inspirational books can increase your happiness. These books can give you fresh ideas and positive outlooks on life. They can help you see things in a new way. Many great books can inspire you. “The Happiness Project” by Gretchen Rubin is a popular choice. It shares the author’s yearlong journey to find more joy in her life. Another good pick is “You Are a Badass” by Jen Sincero. This book helps you spot negative thoughts and replace them with positive ones. It’s full of fun exercises to improve your mindset. Don’t forget about books on simple living. They can help you focus on what really matters. “Goodbye, Things” by Fumio Sasaki is a great example. It shows how less stuff can lead to more happiness. 5. Spend time in nature Getting outside can make you happier. Try to spend at least two hours a week in nature. This can be one long outing or several shorter trips. For me, I like to go outside every day (of course, there are some days where I don’t), as I find that it greatly improves my mood. You don’t need to go far. A local park or trail works great. Even sitting in your backyard or on your porch counts. Nature helps lower stress and anxiety, and it can improve your mood and make you feel better overall. Remember, you don’t need fancy equipment or a big adventure. Just step outside and breathe in some fresh air. Recommended reading: 59 Things To Do Instead of Watching TV 6. Nurture relationships Close relationships are the key to happiness. I recommend that you spend time with friends and family. Make an effort to stay in touch, even when life gets busy. This is my big life goal right now – to simply slow down and spend as much time with family and friends as I can. If someone asks to hang out or to go on a trip with them, I am saying yes! Here are some tips to nurture relationships: Be a good listener. Pay attention when others talk, which shows that you care about what they’re saying. This helps build stronger bonds. Do fun activities together. Try new things with your loved ones. Go for a hike, learn a new skill, or play a game. Shared experiences create lasting memories. Be reliable. If you make plans, stick to them. Show up on time and do what you say you’ll do. This builds trust and makes people want to be around you. Show appreciation. Tell your friends and family what you like about them. Thank them for their help and support. Small acts of kindness go a long way. Be positive. Try to focus on the good things in your relationships. Avoid constant complaining or negativity. A cheerful attitude can improve your connections. Make time for quality conversations. Put away your phone and really talk to people. Ask about their lives, hopes, and dreams. 7. Laugh often Laughing is a great way to feel happier. It can make your day brighter and help you deal with stress. Due to this, I recommend that you try to find things that make you laugh every day. This could be as simple as watching funny videos or TV shows that make you chuckle. Or, you could spend time with friends who have a good sense of humor, as they can help you see the funny side of life. Don’t be afraid to laugh at yourself. When you make a mistake, try to see the humor in it, because this can help you feel better about small problems. 8. Get enough sleep Sleep is super important for feeling happy and healthy. Try to get 7-9 hours of sleep each night. This helps your body and mind rest and get ready for the next day. Make your bedroom comfy for sleeping, which may mean keeping it cool and dark (this is what I like, but you may be different!). More tips: Create a bedtime routine. Go to bed and wake up at the same time every day. This helps your body know when it’s time to sleep. Put away your phone, tablet, and computer at least 30 minutes before bed. The light from screens can make it harder to fall asleep. Plus, it can be so easy to scroll on your phone for hours if you’re not careful. If you have trouble sleeping, try relaxing activities before bed. You could read a book, listen to calm music, or do some light stretching. Remember, good sleep habits can make a big difference in how you feel. When you sleep well, you’ll have more energy and feel happier during the day. 9. Eat nutritious foods Eating healthy foods can make you happier. Your body needs good fuel to work well, and this includes your brain, which affects your mood. This can include cooking at home more often, which is great because it’s usually cheaper and healthier than eating out. You can control what goes into your meals and make them tastier too. Drink plenty of water too. Being thirsty can make you feel tired and grumpy. 10. Limit screen time Too much screen time can make you less happy. So, I recommend that you try to cut back on how much you use your phone, tablet, or computer each day. Tips to lower your screen time: Put your phone and laptop in another room when you’re relaxing at home. This makes it harder to grab them without thinking. Daily habits that can help improve your life include starting your day with gratitude and thinking of 2 or 3 things you’re thankful for each morning. It can be hard to feel happy even when things get tough – I understand. So, focus on what you can control. When life feels hard, think about small actions you can take to make things better. Ways to live a joyful life while being on your own include finding a hobby that you enjoy, as this can give you a sense of purpose and fulfillment. Are you looking for simple habits for living a happy life?

Everyone wants to be happy. But finding happiness can feel hard sometimes. The good news is that there are simple things you can do every day to feel better.

Small habits can make a big difference in how happy you feel. You don’t need to make huge changes to your life. Instead, focus on easy steps that fit into your regular routine. By adding these habits bit by bit, you can create a happier life for yourself.

Happiness and money are also connected (which is why I’m talking about this on a money blog!). When you feel happy, it’s easier to make good choices with your money. Simple habits, like being thankful, exercising, or going outside, can help you feel better and spend less. For example, if you’re less stressed, you might not feel like buying things you don’t need. Spending time with friends or helping others is free and can make you feel good too. These small steps can help you be happier and save money at the same time.

Simple Habits for Living a Happy Life

Below are 12 simple habits for living a happy life.

1. Practice gratitude daily

Being thankful can make you happier.

You can do this in many ways, such as by keeping a gratitude journal where you write down things you’re grateful for each day. This can be as simple as a sunny day or a tasty meal.

Other ways include:

  • You can also share your thanks with others. Tell a friend or family member why you appreciate them. A quick text or phone call can brighten their day and yours.
  • Look for small joys in your everyday life. Maybe it’s the smell of fresh coffee or a stranger’s smile. Noticing these little things can change how you see the world.
  • Try to find the good even in tough times. It’s not always easy, but it can help you stay positive. Maybe you learned something new or grew stronger from a challenge.
  • You can also show gratitude through actions. Help a neighbor or volunteer in your community. Giving back can make you feel good and spread kindness to others.

Remember, practicing gratitude takes time. Start small and make it a habit. Soon, you might find yourself feeling happier and more content with life.

2. Exercise regularly

Getting active is a great way to feel happier. You don’t need to run marathons or lift heavy weights. Even a short walk each day can make a big difference.

Exercise helps your body and boosts your mood. It can also help you sleep better at night. When you sleep well, you feel better during the day.

Try to move your body for 30 minutes most days. You can split this into smaller chunks if that’s easier. Maybe a 10-minute walk in the morning, afternoon, and evening.

Another tip is to pick activities you enjoy. This could be dancing, hiking, swimming, or playing a sport. When you have fun, you’re more likely to keep doing it.

3. Meditate for 10 minutes

Taking just 5-10 minutes out of your day to meditate can make a big difference in your life. It’s a simple habit that can help you feel calmer and more relaxed.

You don’t need any special equipment to meditate, which is really nice about meditation! Just find a quiet spot where you won’t be bothered. Sit comfortably and focus on your breathing.

Even short meditation sessions can help you feel less stressed. You might find it easier to focus on tasks throughout the day. Some people also sleep better when they meditate regularly.

There are lots of free apps and videos that can guide you through meditation. These can be helpful if you’re not sure where to start.

4. Read inspirational books

Reading inspirational books can increase your happiness. These books can give you fresh ideas and positive outlooks on life. They can help you see things in a new way.

Many great books can inspire you. “The Happiness Project” by Gretchen Rubin is a popular choice. It shares the author’s yearlong journey to find more joy in her life.

Another good pick is “You Are a Badass” by Jen Sincero. This book helps you spot negative thoughts and replace them with positive ones. It’s full of fun exercises to improve your mindset.

Don’t forget about books on simple living. They can help you focus on what really matters. “Goodbye, Things” by Fumio Sasaki is a great example. It shows how less stuff can lead to more happiness.

5. Spend time in nature

Getting outside can make you happier. Try to spend at least two hours a week in nature. This can be one long outing or several shorter trips.

For me, I like to go outside every day (of course, there are some days where I don’t), as I find that it greatly improves my mood.

You don’t need to go far. A local park or trail works great. Even sitting in your backyard or on your porch counts.

Nature helps lower stress and anxiety, and it can improve your mood and make you feel better overall.

Remember, you don’t need fancy equipment or a big adventure. Just step outside and breathe in some fresh air.

Recommended reading: 59 Things To Do Instead of Watching TV

6. Nurture relationships

Close relationships are the key to happiness.

I recommend that you spend time with friends and family. Make an effort to stay in touch, even when life gets busy.

This is my big life goal right now – to simply slow down and spend as much time with family and friends as I can. If someone asks to hang out or to go on a trip with them, I am saying yes!

Here are some tips to nurture relationships:

  • Be a good listener. Pay attention when others talk, which shows that you care about what they’re saying. This helps build stronger bonds.
  • Do fun activities together. Try new things with your loved ones. Go for a hike, learn a new skill, or play a game. Shared experiences create lasting memories.
  • Be reliable. If you make plans, stick to them. Show up on time and do what you say you’ll do. This builds trust and makes people want to be around you.
  • Show appreciation. Tell your friends and family what you like about them. Thank them for their help and support. Small acts of kindness go a long way.
  • Be positive. Try to focus on the good things in your relationships. Avoid constant complaining or negativity. A cheerful attitude can improve your connections.
  • Make time for quality conversations. Put away your phone and really talk to people. Ask about their lives, hopes, and dreams.

7. Laugh often

Laughing is a great way to feel happier. It can make your day brighter and help you deal with stress. Due to this, I recommend that you try to find things that make you laugh every day.

This could be as simple as watching funny videos or TV shows that make you chuckle. Or, you could spend time with friends who have a good sense of humor, as they can help you see the funny side of life.

Don’t be afraid to laugh at yourself. When you make a mistake, try to see the humor in it, because this can help you feel better about small problems.

8. Get enough sleep

Sleep is super important for feeling happy and healthy. Try to get 7-9 hours of sleep each night. This helps your body and mind rest and get ready for the next day.

Make your bedroom comfy for sleeping, which may mean keeping it cool and dark (this is what I like, but you may be different!).

More tips:

  • Create a bedtime routine. Go to bed and wake up at the same time every day. This helps your body know when it’s time to sleep.
  • Put away your phone, tablet, and computer at least 30 minutes before bed. The light from screens can make it harder to fall asleep. Plus, it can be so easy to scroll on your phone for hours if you’re not careful.
  • If you have trouble sleeping, try relaxing activities before bed. You could read a book, listen to calm music, or do some light stretching.

Remember, good sleep habits can make a big difference in how you feel. When you sleep well, you’ll have more energy and feel happier during the day.

9. Eat nutritious foods

Eating healthy foods can make you happier. Your body needs good fuel to work well, and this includes your brain, which affects your mood.

This can include cooking at home more often, which is great because it’s usually cheaper and healthier than eating out. You can control what goes into your meals and make them tastier too.

Drink plenty of water too. Being thirsty can make you feel tired and grumpy.

10. Limit screen time

Too much screen time can make you less happy. So, I recommend that you try to cut back on how much you use your phone, tablet, or computer each day.

Tips to lower your screen time:

  • Put your phone and laptop in another room when you’re relaxing at home. This makes it harder to grab them without thinking. I find that (of course) I use my phone a lot less when it’s sitting on the charger in another room than sitting right next to me when I’m working.
  • Set a timer when you use screens. When it goes off, take a break and do something else.
  • Turn off notifications on your phone. This stops it from always pulling your attention away. I have notifications turned off for almost everything on my phone so I don’t feel as inclined to check it all the time.
  • Find fun things to do that don’t need screens. You could read a book, go for a walk, or play a board game with friends.
  • Make your bedroom a no-screen zone. This can help you sleep better at night.
  • Use apps that track your screen time. They show you how much you’re really using your devices each day.
  • Try having screen-free days or weekends. You might be surprised how much more relaxed you feel.
  • When you do use screens, be picky about what you watch or read. Choose things that make you feel good or teach you something new.

Recommended reading: 100+ Things To Do Instead Of Social Media

11. Volunteer in your community

Giving your time to help others can make you happier. Volunteering lets you meet new people and make friends, and it also helps you feel good about yourself.

There are many ways to volunteer. You could help at a food bank or animal shelter. You might read to kids at a library or visit people in nursing homes.

You don’t need a lot of time to volunteer. Even an hour a week can make a difference. Start small and see how it fits into your life.

12. Care for yourself

Taking care of yourself is super important for a happy life.

So, don’t forget about your mental health. Take breaks when you feel stressed, and try deep breathing or spending time in nature. These can help you feel calm and relaxed.

And, make time for things you love. Read a book, listen to music, or hang out with friends. Doing fun stuff is part of taking care of yourself too.

Lastly, be kind to yourself. Treat yourself like you would a good friend. Say nice things to yourself and celebrate your wins, big and small. I feel like we are our own worst critics, so being nice to yourself can go a long way!

Frequently Asked Questions

Below are answers to common questions about how to live a happy life.

What are some daily habits that can help improve my life?

Daily habits that can help improve your life include starting your day with gratitude and thinking of 2 or 3 things you’re thankful for each morning. I also recommend exercising or getting outside for at least 30 minutes a day – even just for a walk or sitting on your porch. And, I recommend reading for 15-30 minutes before bed, such as by picking books that inspire you or teach you something new.

How can I feel happy even when things get tough?

It can be hard to feel happy even when things get tough – I understand. So, focus on what you can control. When life feels hard, think about small actions you can take to make things better. Also, talk to a friend or family member because sharing your feelings can help you feel less alone and more supported.

What are some psychological tips for staying joyful?

Some psychological tips for staying joyful include practicing mindfulness by paying attention to the present moment without judgment (this can reduce stress and increase happiness) as well as reframing negative thoughts – try to find a positive spin on challenging situations, as this can help you stay optimistic.

How can someone live a joyful life while being on their own?

Ways to live a joyful life while being on your own include finding a hobby that you enjoy, as this can give you a sense of purpose and fulfillment. Also, joining a club or group and meeting people who share your interests can help you feel connected and less lonely. Lastly, learn to enjoy your own company. Try solo activities like reading, cooking, or taking yourself on fun outings.

Simple Habits for Living a Happy Life – Summary

I hope you enjoyed my article on the best simple habits for living a happy life.

Being happy doesn’t have to be hard. Simple habits like saying thank you, moving your body, or spending time outside can help you feel better every day.

These small changes don’t just make you happier – they can also save you money and help you focus on what matters most. By adding these habits to your life little by little, you can build a routine that makes you feel good.

What simple habits would you add to my list? Share in the comments below!
